name: p-amino_phenyl_acetate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 1,1'-Phenylene is a basic unit for our comparison, with a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a phenyl group and an amino group. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +30°C. The amino group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may contribute around +10°C.
